metadata.title: CVE-2022-3078 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 5.16-rc6. There is alack of check after calling vzalloc() and lack of free after allocation indrivers/media/test-drivers/vidtv/vidtv_s302m.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3078` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1011-bluefield - 5.15.0-1011.13
Available for NVIDIA BlueField platforms

linux-image-unsigned-6.0.0-1006-oem - 6.0.0-1006.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-1004-oem - 6.1.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-28-generic - 5.19.0-28.29~22.04.1
linux-image-5.19.0-28-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-28.29~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-28-generic - 5.19.0-28.29~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-28-generic-64k - 5.19.0-28.29~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1017-lowlatency - 5.19.0-1017.18~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1017-lowlatency-64k - 5.19.0-1017.18~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1020-azure - 5.19.0-1020.21~22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1005-nvidia - 5.15.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1005-nvidia-64k - 5.15.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1004-nvidia - 6.5.0-1004.4
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1004-nvidia-64k - 6.5.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-1022-xilinx-zynqmp - 5.15.0-1022.26
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux-bluefield package in bluefield/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1011.13').
linux-oem-6.0 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.0.0-1006.6').
linux-oem-6.1 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.1.0-1004.4').
linux-hwe-5.19 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-28.29~22.04.1').
linux-lowlatency-hwe-5.19 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-1017.18~22.04.1').
linux-azure-5.19 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-1020.21~22.04.1').
linux-nvidia package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1005.5').
linux-nvidia-6.5 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.5.0-1004.4').
linux-realtime: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by Ubuntu Pro ppa version').
linux-xilinx-zynqmp package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1022.26').
